page.title: 08ASHDOWN FOREST
page.content: We have been on many walks in our area. The forest is hilly, with land of 400 feet high. There are lots of streams and wild animals. A Board of Conservators looks after the forest with the help of their Rangers. On the forest there are many different trees. There are several roundels of pine trees such as Gill's Lap and King's Standing. Some of the trees on the forest are scots pine, birch, willow, alder, oak and holly. There are also flowers which are foxglove, tormentil, orchids and heather. There are some farms on the forest; many people ride. In our area there are some riding centres. People have lovely picnics. On the forest there are many birds, insects and butterflies. We found a sandstone quarry.
